meanings.definition: One who runs away to marry.
meanings.sent1: The eloper and his bride had a beautiful wedding in a hidden garden.
meanings.sent2: The young eloper decided to elope with his true love instead of having a big wedding.
meanings.sent3: The eloper's friends were surprised by the sudden wedding announcement.
meanings.sent4: The eloper's bold move to marry in secret left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The eloper's romantic gesture captured the hearts of all who witnessed it.

meanings.definition: To run away secretly to marry.
meanings.sent1: She elopered with her partner under the starlit sky.
meanings.sent2: The couple decided to elope to avoid the stress of a traditional wedding.
meanings.sent3: The eloper's quick getaway to tie the knot was both exciting and nerve-wracking.
meanings.sent4: The decision to eloper was a leap of faith into a new chapter of their lives.
meanings.sent5: The eloper's escape to wed in private was a moment they would never forget.
